Uses of Class
main.GameWindow

Packages that use GameWindow
Package
Description
main
 

  • Uses of GameWindow in main

    Subclasses of GameWindow in main
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    BattleWindow
    An class which uses Java Swing to create a window, used in conjunction with an instance of Battle, that the user may fight battles
    class 
    EnvironmentWindow
    An class which uses Java Swing to create a window, used in conjunction with an instance of Player, to start the game
    class 
    MainWindow
    An class which uses Java Swing to create a window, used in conjunction with instances of classes Battle, Shop, Player and "Window" classes such as BattleWindow, MenuWindow and ShopWindow, to provide the main game play loop of the game
    class 
    MenuWindow
    An class which uses Java Swing to create a window, used in conjunction with an instance of Player, that the user may manage their monsters and items
    class 
    MonJoinsWindow
    The class that implements the GUI needed to run the monJoins random event
    class 
    ShopMenu
    An class which uses Java Swing to create a window, used in conjunction with an instance of Shop, that the user may go to the Shop
    Fields in main declared as GameWindow
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private GameWindow
    MonJoinsWindow.mainWindow
    A GameWindow variable, which holds the window that created this window, used so that we may go back to that window
    private GameWindow
    MenuWindow.window
    A GameWindow variable, contains the window that created this window, used to that the user may go back to that window once the user is done with this one

    Monster.levelUp(GameWindow window)
    An instance variable, its used to "level up" a monster what this does is it increases an instance of Monsters damage, maxHealth, healAmount based on some formulas, and displays these changes to the user, returns void

    RandomEvent.startEvent(Monster mon, Player player, GameWindow window)
